TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit RowNotInTableException extends System.Data.DataException

Docs.summary: Represents the exception that is thrown when you try to perform an operation on a that is not in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RowNotInTableException is thrown when invoking the following methods on a row that has been deleted with either the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.Delete%2A> or the <xref:System.Data.DataRowCollection.Remove%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.AcceptChanges%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.GetChildRows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.GetParentRow%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.GetParentRows%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.RejectChanges%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Data.DataRow.SetParentRow%2A?displayProperty=fullName>
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> with one <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> and 10 <xref:System.Data.DataRow> objects. After deleting a row, the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.AcceptChanges%2A> method is called causing the RowNotInTableException to be thrown.
[!code-vb[Classic WebData RowNotInTableException Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.data.rownotinta_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic WebData RowNotInTableException Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.data.rownotinta_1.cs)]

The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
